sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a rectangle.
message_1: A rectangle has a length of 8 cm and a width of 5 cm. What is the perimeter of the rectangle in centimeters?
message_2:
To find the perimeter of a rectangle, you can use the formula P = 2L + 2W, where P is the perimeter, L is the length, and W is the width. 

In this case, the length (L) is 8 cm and the width (W) is 5 cm. 

Substitute the values into the formula:

P = 2(8) + 2(5)
P = 16 + 10
P = 26 cm

The perimeter of the rectangle is 26 centimeters.
